channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How to Protect Yourself From Portable Point-of-Sale Scams
item.description: POS scams are difficult but not impossible to pull off. Here's how they work—and how you can protect yourself.

item.title: Lovense Gemini Nipple Clamps Review: New Sensations
item.description: These clamps just might offer the vibrating sensation you've been seeking.

item.title: Best Open Earbuds, Tested and Reviewed (2025): Bose and More
item.description: These wireless earbuds with an “open” design let you zone out to your music while also keeping aware of your surroundings.

item.title: 3 Best Steam Mops, Tested for Months (2025)
item.description: Get those floors squeaky clean with the help of these steamy gadgets.

item.title: Sam Altman addresses ‘bumpy’ GPT-5 rollout, bringing 4o back, and the ‘chart crime’
item.description: The Reddit AMA got spicy as users peppered OpenAI with questions, and some asked the company to bring back its previous model.

item.title: RIP, Microsoft Lens, a simple little app that’s getting replaced by AI
item.description: Microsoft is killing Lens, a handy mobile scanning app with over 90 million downloads.

item.title: Former Googlers’ AI startup OpenArt now creates ‘brain rot’ videos in just one click
